intro: Haplophyllum hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish haplophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to drought conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
